user.title: Select Controller Type
user.description: Choose whether your Omada controller is self-hosted (local) or cloud-hosted.

data_description.controller_type: Cloud-hosted uses TP-Link cloud; local connects directly to your controller

cloud.title: Select Cloud Region
cloud.description: Select the region where your cloud-hosted Omada controller is located.

data_description.region: Choose the cloud region matching your Omada controller deployment

local.title: Local Controller URL
local.description: Enter the URL of your self-hosted Omada controller (e.g., {example_url}).

data_description.api_url: Full URL including protocol and port

credentials.title: Omada API Credentials
credentials.description:
Enter your Omada Open API credentials.

You can find these in your Omada controller:
1. Go to Settings > Platform Integration > Open API
2. Create a new application (Client Credentials Mode)
3. Copy the Client ID, Client Secret, and Omada ID

{controller_info}

data_description.omada_id: MSP ID or Customer ID from your Open API application
data_description.client_id: OAuth2 Client ID from your Open API application
data_description.client_secret: OAuth2 Client Secret from your Open API application

sites.title: Select Sites
sites.description:
Select which sites you want to monitor. Found {site_count} site(s).

You can select multiple sites or all of them.

data_description.selected_sites: Select one or more Omada sites to monitor devices and clients

clients.title: Select Clients to Track (Optional)
clients.description:
Select which network clients you want to track as Home Assistant devices. Found {client_count} client(s).

This is optional - you can skip this step by clicking Submit without selecting any clients. You can add more clients later via the integration options.

⚠️ Showing first 200 clients only to prevent UI issues.

data_description.selected_clients: Select network clients to create device tracker entities for

applications.title: Select Applications to Track (Optional)
applications.description:
Select which applications you want to track for network traffic monitoring. Found {app_count} application(s).

For each selected application, upload and download sensors will be created for each tracked client. Traffic data resets daily at midnight.

This is optional - you can skip this step or modify the selection later via integration options.

Note: Application tracking requires DPI (Deep Packet Inspection) to be enabled on your gateway.

data_description.selected_applications: Select applications for per-client traffic monitoring (requires DPI)

reauth_confirm.title: Re-authenticate Omada Integration
reauth_confirm.description: The Omada API credentials have expired or are invalid. Please re-enter your credentials to continue.

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure Omada Integration
reconfigure.description:
Update the connection settings for this Omada integration. You can change the controller type, region, URL, and credentials.

For cloud controllers, select a region. For local controllers, provide the API URL.

Credentials will be validated before saving.

data_description.controller_type: Cloud-hosted uses TP-Link cloud; local connects directly to your controller
data_description.api_url: Full URL including protocol (only for local controllers)
data_description.omada_id: MSP ID or Customer ID from your Open API application
data_description.client_id: OAuth2 Client ID from your Open API application
data_description.client_secret: OAuth2 Client Secret from your Open API application

reconfigure_sites.title: Select Sites
reconfigure_sites.description:
Select which sites you want to monitor. Found {site_count} site(s).

Previously selected sites are pre-selected.

error.cannot_connect: Failed to connect to Omada API. Please check the URL and network connectivity.
error.invalid_auth: Invalid authentication credentials. Please check your Client ID, Client Secret, and Omada ID.
error.invalid_url: Invalid URL format. Please use http:// or https://
error.no_sites: No sites found on this controller. Please ensure at least one site is configured.
error.unknown: Unexpected error occurred. Please check logs for details.

abort.already_configured: This Omada controller is already configured

client_selection.title: Modify Client Tracking
client_selection.description:
Select which network clients you want to track as Home Assistant devices. Found {client_count} client(s).

Currently tracking {selected_count} client(s).

You can add or remove clients from this list. The integration will reload automatically after saving.

⚠️ Showing first 200 clients only to prevent UI issues.

application_selection.title: Modify Application Tracking
application_selection.description:
Select which applications you want to track for network traffic monitoring. Found {app_count} application(s).

Currently tracking {selected_count} application(s).

For each selected application, upload and download sensors will be created for each tracked client. Traffic data resets daily at midnight.

The integration will reload automatically after saving.

update_intervals.title: Update Intervals
update_intervals.description:
Configure how frequently each data type is polled from the Omada controller (in seconds). Lower values provide more responsive updates but increase API load.

Valid range: 10–3600 seconds.

config_entry_not_found.message: Config entry {config_entry_id} not found or is not an Omada integration.

no_runtime_data.message: No runtime data available for config entry {config_entry_id}.

write_access_denied.title: Omada API credentials have read-only access
write_access_denied.description: The API credentials configured for this integration have viewer-only permissions. Device controls such as PoE switches, LED toggles, and reboot buttons are unavailable. To enable full control, update the Omada Open API application to grant write access and reconfigure the integration.

dpi_no_gateway.title: Application traffic tracking requires a gateway
dpi_no_gateway.description: You have selected applications for DPI-based traffic tracking, but no Omada gateway was found on any configured site. Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) requires an Omada gateway in the network. Add a gateway to your Omada network or remove the application tracking selection in the integration options.
